section1.title: 1. Introduction
section1.content:
BrainDock ("we", "us", "our") is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our focus assistance application ("the Application").

This policy is designed to comply with the Australian Privacy Principles (APPs) under the Privacy Act 1988 (Cth), as well as provide transparency for users in other jurisdictions including the European Union (GDPR) and United Kingdom (UK GDPR).

Please read this Privacy Policy carefully. By using the Application, you consent to the practices described in this policy.

section2.title: 2. About Us
section2.content:
BrainDock is a focus assistance application that helps users observe their study and work sessions using camera-based presence awareness.

Contact Information:

  • Email: morayya@thebraindock.com or help.thebraindock@gmail.com
  • Website: thebraindock.com

section3.title: 3. Information We Collect
section3.intro: We collect different types of information to provide and improve our service.

subsection1.title: 3.1 Camera Frame Data (Processed, Not Stored)
subsection1.content:
What we capture:

  • Visual frames from your device's camera during active sessions started by you.

What we analyse:

  • Whether a person is present at the desk
  • Whether the person appears to be engaged with distraction devices (phones, tablets, game controllers)
  • General presence indicators (at desk vs. away)

What we do NOT analyse or collect:

  • Your identity or facial features for recognition purposes
  • Biometric templates or biometric identifiers
  • Audio from your microphone
  • Keystrokes or typing content

Processing:

  • Frames are captured approximately every 3 seconds during active sessions only
  • Frames are transmitted to our AI processing providers (OpenAI or Google Gemini) for analysis
  • Frames are NOT stored locally on your device
  • Frames are NOT stored on our servers

subsection2.title: 3.2 Screen Awareness Data (Processed Locally On Your Device)
subsection2.content:
What we observe:

  • Active window and browser tab titles (e.g., "YouTube - Google Chrome")
  • Browser URLs when detectable
  • Active application names

How it works:

  • Window titles and URLs are compared against your list of distraction apps/websites
  • This processing happens locally on your device
  • Window titles and URLs are NOT sent to third-party services (unless AI Screenshot Analysis is enabled)

What we do NOT observe:

  • Content within windows or applications
  • Text you type or read
  • Files you open or create

subsection3.title: 3.3 AI Screenshot Analysis (User-Controlled)
subsection3.content:
This feature is disabled by default. You must explicitly enable it in Application settings.

When enabled:

  • The Application captures screenshots of your screen
  • Screenshots are transmitted to our AI providers (OpenAI or Google Gemini) for analysis
  • AI analyses the screenshot to identify distraction content
  • Screenshots are processed in real-time and NOT stored on your device or our servers

What the AI analyses:

  • Whether distraction apps/websites are visible
  • General screen content category (work, entertainment, social media, etc.)

What the AI does NOT extract:

  • Text content or readable information from screenshots
  • Personal data visible on screen
  • File names, passwords, or sensitive information

Important warnings:

  • Screenshots may capture sensitive information visible on your screen
  • Ensure no confidential information is visible when this feature is enabled
  • You can disable this feature at any time

subsection4.title: 3.4 Session Log Data (Local)
subsection4.content:
The following data is generated and stored locally on your device:

Data TypeDescriptionStorage Location
Session timestampsStart and end times of focus sessionsYour device
Event logsTimestamps of state changes (present, away, distraction identified)Your device
Focus statisticsCalculated metrics (focus time, distraction count, etc.)Your device

subsection5.content:
When you purchase the Application:

Terms acceptanceStripeRecord of consent

We do not directly collect or store your payment card details.

subsection6.title: 3.6 Technical and Diagnostic Data
subsection6.content:
We may collect minimal technical data for troubleshooting:

  • Error logs (may include timestamps, error messages)
  • Application version
  • Operating system type

Note: We design our logging to avoid capturing personal information. However, error logs may inadvertently contain personal data in some circumstances.

section4.title: 4. Explicit Statement: No Biometric Data Collection
section4.content:
We explicitly confirm that BrainDock does NOT collect biometric information.

Specifically, we do NOT:

  • Perform facial recognition or facial identification
  • Create facial geometry maps or templates
  • Store biometric identifiers or biometric templates
  • Use biometric information for automated biometric verification or identification
  • Match or verify user identity using biological characteristics
  • Create profiles that could uniquely identify you

Our AI processing analyses only:

  • General presence (is a person visible?)
  • Position (is the person at the desk or away?)
  • Object identification (is a phone/tablet/controller being actively used?)

This is fundamentally different from biometric processing. We process the content of frames to identify objects and presence. We do not extract or store any biometric characteristics.

subsection1.title: 6.1 AI Processing Providers
subsection1.intro: We use third-party AI services for image analysis. Only one provider is used at a time during any given session, but we may switch between providers. Our current providers are:

openai.title: 6.1.1 OpenAI
openai.content:
What is disclosed: Camera frames during active sessions

Why: To perform AI-based presence and object identification

Location: United States

Their data practices:

  • OpenAI may retain API data as per OpenAI's policy
  • OpenAI Privacy Policy: https://openai.com/privacy
  • OpenAI API Data Usage: https://openai.com/policies/api-data-usage-policies

google.title: 6.1.2 Google (Gemini)
google.content:
What is disclosed: Camera frames during active sessions

Why: To perform AI-based presence and object identification

Location: United States

Their data practices:

  • Google's Gemini API may retain data for safety observation and abuse prevention
  • Google Privacy Policy: https://policies.google.com/privacy
  • Google Cloud Data Processing Terms: https://cloud.google.com/terms/data-processing-terms
  • Gemini API Terms: https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/terms

subsection1.safeguards:
Our safeguards (apply to all providers):

  • We use API-only services (not consumer products)
  • We send only the minimum data required for analysis
  • We use optimised settings to reduce data transmission where available
  • We do not send identifying metadata with frames

subsection2.title: 6.2 Payment Processor (Stripe)
subsection2.content:
What is disclosed: Payment and contact information you provide at checkout

Why: To process your payment and deliver your licence

Location: United States (with global operations)

Their data practices: https://stripe.com/privacy

subsection3.title: 6.3 Other Disclosures
subsection3.content:
We may disclose your information:

  • Legal Requirements: If required by law, court order, or government request
  • Protection of Rights: To protect our rights, privacy, safety, or property
  • Business Transfer: In connection with a merger, acquisition, or sale of assets (with notice to you)

We do NOT:

  • Sell your personal information
  • Share data for third-party marketing
  • Trade in personal information

section7.title: 7. Cross-Border Data Transfers (APP 8)
section7.intro: Your camera frame data is transferred to the United States for processing by our AI providers (OpenAI and/or Google Gemini).

subsection1.title: 7.1 Why We Transfer Data Overseas
subsection1.content: We use cloud-based AI vision APIs (OpenAI Vision and Google Gemini) because they provide the most accurate and privacy-preserving method for presence awareness without requiring on-device facial recognition or biometric processing.

subsection2.title: 7.2 Protections for Overseas Transfers
subsection2.content:
We take the following steps to protect your data:

  1. Contractual Protections: Both OpenAI and Google are bound by their published data usage policies and enterprise terms
  2. Data Minimisation: We send only camera frames (and screenshots if enabled), not identifying metadata
  3. No Permanent Storage: Frames and screenshots are processed in real-time and not permanently stored by us
  4. Reputable Providers: Both OpenAI and Google maintain SOC 2 compliance and enterprise security standards

subsection3.title: 7.3 Your Consent
subsection3.content: By using the Application, you consent to this cross-border transfer. If you do not consent, please do not use the Application.

subsection4.title: 7.4 EU/UK Users
subsection4.content: For users in the European Union or United Kingdom, transfers to the US are conducted in accordance with applicable data transfer mechanisms under GDPR/UK GDPR.

subsection1.title: 8.1 Your Control Over Local Data
subsection1.content:
All session data and reports are stored locally on your device. You can delete this data at any time by:

  1. Deleting files from the Application's data directory
  2. Uninstalling the Application
  3. Using your operating system's file management tools

subsection2.title: 8.2 Data We Cannot Delete
subsection2.content: Once frames are transmitted to our AI providers (OpenAI or Google Gemini), their retention is governed by those providers' respective policies. We cannot delete this data on your behalf.

section9.title: 9. Data Security (APP 11)
section9.intro: We implement reasonable security measures to protect your information:

subsection1.title: 9.1 Technical Measures
subsection1.content:
• Encryption in Transit: All data transmitted to third parties uses TLS/HTTPS encryption
  • Local Storage: Session data is stored in standard file formats on your device, protected by your device's security
  • No Central Database: We do not maintain a central database of user session data
  • API Security: We use secure API authentication with our service providers

subsection2.title: 9.2 Organisational Measures
subsection2.content:
• Access to systems is limited to authorised personnel
  • We follow secure development practices
  • We regularly review and update security measures

subsection3.title: 9.3 Your Responsibilities
subsection3.content:
You are responsible for:

  • Securing your device with appropriate passwords/biometrics
  • Keeping your operating system and the Application updated
  • Not sharing your licence key with others
  • Protecting any exported reports containing session data

subsection1.title: 10.1 AI Provider Responsibility
subsection1.content: Visual data is shared with our AI providers (OpenAI or Google Gemini) for processing. Any data breach involving this data is the responsibility of those AI providers as per their respective policies.

subsection2.title: 10.2 Limitation of Liability
subsection2.content:
BrainDock expressly disclaims liability for any data breaches, security incidents, or unauthorised access that occurs:

  • At the AI provider level (OpenAI or Google Gemini)
  • At the payment processor level (Stripe)
  • On your local device due to unauthorised access

subsection3.title: 10.3 Local Data
subsection3.content: Session data stored locally on your device is your responsibility to secure. If your device is compromised, you should report to relevant authorities as appropriate.

subsection1.title: 11.1 Australian Users (APP 12, 13)
subsection1.content:
Under the Australian Privacy Principles, you have the right to:

  • Access: Request access to personal information we may hold about you
  • Correction: Request correction of inaccurate information
  • Complaint: Lodge a complaint if you believe we have breached the APPs

To exercise these rights, contact us using the details in Section 2.

Note: Because most data is stored locally on your device, you already have direct access to and control over this information.

subsection2.title: 11.2 EU/UK Users (GDPR Rights)
subsection2.content:
If you are in the EU or UK, you have additional rights including:

  • Right to erasure ("right to be forgotten")
  • Right to restrict processing
  • Right to data portability
  • Right to object to processing
  • Rights related to automated decision-making

subsection3.title: 11.3 How to Make a Request
subsection3.content:
Contact us at morayya@thebraindock.com or help.thebraindock@gmail.com with:

  • Your name and contact details
  • A description of what you are requesting
  • Any information to help us locate your data

We will respond within 30 days (or sooner if required by applicable law).

subsection4.title: 11.4 Complaints
subsection4.content:
If you are not satisfied with our response, you may lodge a complaint with:

Australia:
Office of the Australian Information Commissioner (OAIC)
Website: www.oaic.gov.au
Phone: 1300 363 992

EU:
Your local Data Protection Authority

UK:
Information Commissioner's Office (ICO)
Website: www.ico.org.uk

section12.title: 12. Third-Party Capture Warning
section12.intro: IMPORTANT: Your camera may capture other people in your environment.

subsection1.title: 12.1 Your Obligations
subsection1.content:
If other individuals may appear in your camera's view (housemates, family members, colleagues, visitors, people on video calls), you are responsible for:

  • Informing them that camera capture is occurring
  • Obtaining their consent where required by law
  • Positioning your camera to minimise third-party capture
  • Not using the Application if you cannot obtain appropriate consent

subsection2.title: 12.2 Our Limitations
subsection2.content:
We cannot:

  • Identify or filter out third parties from frames
  • Obtain consent on your behalf
  • Accept responsibility for your capture of others

subsection3.title: 12.3 Recommended Practices
subsection3.content:
• Use the Application in a private space
  • Position your camera to show only your immediate workspace
  • Pause sessions when others enter your space
  • Inform household members that you use focus assistance software

subsection1.title: 13.1 Users Under 18
subsection1.content:
Users under 18 years of age should use the Application under parents / legal guardian's supervision or permission or both. The parent or legal guardian is responsible for:

  • Reviewing this Privacy Policy
  • Supervising the user's use of the Application
  • Ensuring appropriate consent for camera capture

subsection2.title: 13.2 Discovery of Minor's Data
subsection2.content: If we learn we have collected personal information from a user under 18 without parental consent, we will take steps to delete that information.

subsection1.title: 14.1 Employee Use
subsection1.content:
If you use BrainDock on your own initiative for personal productivity at work:

  • You are responsible for complying with your employer's policies
  • Session data on your work device may be subject to employer access

subsection2.title: 14.2 Employer Deployment
subsection2.content:
If an employer deploys BrainDock to observe employees:

  • The employer becomes a controller of data collected through the Application
  • The employer must provide their own privacy notice to employees
  • The employer must comply with workplace observation laws
  • We are not responsible for the employer's data handling practices

This Privacy Policy applies to our direct relationship with users, not to employer-employee relationships.

section15.title: 15. Cookies and Web Technologies
section15.content:
The desktop application does not use any web technologies for data collection.

If you visit any associated websites, those sites may use cookies as described in their respective privacy notices.

subsection1.title: 16.1 Updates
subsection1.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Changes will be indicated by the "Last Updated" date at the top.

subsection2.title: 16.2 Notification
subsection2.content:
For material changes, we will notify you through:

  • In-app notification
  • Email (if available)
  • Notice on our website

subsection3.title: 16.3 Your Continued Use
subsection3.content: Your continued use of the Application after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated Privacy Policy.

subsection1.title: 17.1 California Residents (CCPA)
subsection1.content: California residents have specific rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act. Contact us for information about exercising these rights.

subsection2.title: 17.2 Other Jurisdictions
subsection2.content: If you are located in a jurisdiction with specific privacy laws not addressed here, please contact us to discuss how we can accommodate your rights.

section18.content:

section19.title: 19. Questions and Contact
section19.content:
If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us:

Email: morayya@thebraindock.com or help.thebraindock@gmail.com

Website: thebraindock.com

We aim to respond to all enquiries within 30 days.

section20.content:
By using BrainDock, you acknowledge that you have read and understood this Privacy Policy and consent to the collection, use, and disclosure of your information as described herein.

This Privacy Policy was last updated in January 2026.

This policy is designed to comply with applicable privacy laws and regulations globally. However, this document does not constitute legal advice. We recommend consulting with a qualified privacy lawyer for advice specific to your situation.

section1.title: 1. Agreement to Terms and Conditions
section1.content:
By downloading, installing, accessing, or using BrainDock ("the Application", "the App", "we", "us", or "our"), you ("User", "you", or "your") agree to be bound by these Terms and Conditions ("Terms"). If you do not agree to these Terms and Conditions, do not use the Application.

These Terms and Conditions constitute a legally binding agreement between you and BrainDock. Please read them carefully.

section2.title: 2. Description of Service
section2.intro:
BrainDock is a focus assistance application designed to help users observe their study or work sessions. The Application:

  • Uses your device's camera to identify your presence and potential distractions
  • Observes your active window and browser URLs to identify distraction apps/websites
  • Optionally captures screenshots for AI analysis (disabled by default, user-controlled)
  • Sends camera frames and/or screenshots to third-party AI services for real-time analysis
  • Generates session reports summarising your focus patterns
  • Does NOT perform facial recognition, identity verification, or biometric identification

subsection1.title: 2.1 What BrainDock Does
subsection1.content:
• Identifies whether a person is present at the desk
  • Identifies whether you appear to be using distraction devices (phones, tablets, game controllers, etc.)
  • Observes active window titles and browser URLs to identify distraction apps/websites
  • Optional AI Screenshot Analysis: If enabled by you, captures screenshots and sends them to AI for distraction identification (disabled by default)
  • Generates focus session statistics and PDF reports
  • Provides AI-generated insights about your focus patterns

subsection2.title: 2.2 What BrainDock Does NOT Do
subsection2.content:
• No Facial Recognition: We do not identify who you are
  • No Biometric Templates: We do not create, store, or match biometric data
  • No Identity Verification: We do not verify or match your identity across sessions
  • No Video Storage: We do not save or store video footage
  • No Screenshot Storage: Screenshots (if enabled) are processed in real-time and not permanently saved
  • No Continuous Observation: Processing only occurs during active sessions you initiate
  • No Keystroke Logging: We do not capture what you type

subsection1.title: 3.1 Age Requirements
subsection1.content: Users under 18 years of age should use the Application under parents / legal guardian's supervision or permission or both who agree to these Terms and Conditions on your behalf.

subsection2.title: 3.2 Capacity
subsection2.content: By using the Application, you represent that you have the legal capacity to enter into this agreement.

subsection1.title: 4.1 Your Device and Environment
subsection1.content:
You are responsible for:

  • Ensuring you have the legal right to use camera capture on your device
  • The content captured by your camera during sessions
  • Obtaining consent from any third parties who may be captured by your camera

subsection2.title: 4.2 Third-Party Consent Warning
subsection2.content:
IMPORTANT: The Application captures camera frames from your device. If other people (housemates, family members, colleagues, clients on video calls, or passersby) may appear in your camera's view:

  • You are responsible for obtaining their consent before starting a session
  • Consider positioning your camera to minimise capturing others
  • Use the Application in a private space where practical
  • Do not use the Application to observe others without their knowledge and consent

We are not responsible for any privacy violations arising from your capture of third parties.

subsection3.title: 4.3 Prohibited Uses
subsection3.content:
You agree NOT to use the Application:

  • To covertly observe or surveil other individuals
  • In violation of any applicable laws or regulations
  • To capture or process images of minors without parental consent
  • In any manner that infringes the rights of others
  • To circumvent, disable, or interfere with security features

subsection4.title: 4.4 Workplace Use
subsection4.content:
If you use BrainDock in a workplace context (whether as an employee or employer):

  • Employees: Ensure your employer permits personal software on work devices
  • Employers deploying to staff: You must comply with workplace observation laws in your jurisdiction

Australian Employers - Special Notice: If deploying BrainDock to observe employees in Australia, you must comply with state and territory workplace observation legislation, including but not limited to:

  • NSW: Workplace Surveillance Act 2005 - requires written notice at least 14 days before observation begins, specifying the kind of observation, how it will be carried out, when it starts, and whether it is continuous or intermittent
  • VIC: Surveillance Devices Act 1999
  • QLD: Invasion of Privacy Act 1971
  • Other states: Applicable surveillance device legislation

We strongly recommend employers seek independent legal advice before deploying BrainDock for employee observation.

subsection1.content: The Application requires a one-time payment for full access. Current pricing is displayed at the point of purchase.

subsection2.title: 6.2 Payment Processing
subsection2.content: Payments are processed securely through Stripe. By making a payment, you also agree to Stripe's terms of service.

subsection1.content:

subsection2.title: 7.2 Screen Awareness

• The Application observes your active window titles and browser URLs to identify distraction apps/websites
  • This data is processed locally on your device and compared against your list
  • Window titles and URLs are NOT sent to third-party services (unless AI Screenshot Analysis is enabled)

subsection3.title: 7.3 Optional AI Screenshot Analysis

subsection5.title: 7.5 Cross-Border Data Transfer
subsection5.content: Your camera frames and screenshots (if enabled) are transmitted to AI service providers located in the United States of America. Our current providers (OpenAI and Google) operate servers in the United States. By using the Application, you consent to this cross-border transfer. See our Privacy Policy for details on data protection measures.

section8.title: 8. No Biometrics Pledge
section8.content:
We explicitly confirm that BrainDock:

  • Does NOT perform facial recognition or identification
  • Does NOT create biometric templates or profiles
  • Does NOT match or verify user identity
  • Does NOT use biometric information for automated verification or identification
  • Processes only general presence awareness (is someone at the desk?) and object identification (is a phone visible?)

This pledge is a fundamental design principle of our Application.

subsection2.content:

faq.title: Questions & Answers
faq.a1: If you're just getting started, Pro (1 hour) lets you try BrainDock without a big commitment. For regular use, Ultra (10 hours) offers a better per-hour rate. Max (30 hours) is the best value if you plan to use BrainDock daily.
faq.q2: How does the credit system work?
faq.a2: You purchase a pack of hours upfront. Each time you run a focus session - whether using your camera, screen monitoring, or both - time is deducted from your balance. You can top up anytime, and your hours never expire.
faq.q3: Can I switch between camera and screen sessions?
faq.a3: Yes. Your hours work across all session types. Use camera-based focus tracking, screen monitoring, or both at the same time - it all draws from the same balance.
faq.q4: What happens when I run out of hours?
faq.a4: Your session will end and you can top up with another pack right away. Any session data you've already recorded stays in your dashboard - nothing is lost.

privacy.question: Does BrainDock violate my privacy?
privacy.answer: No, privacy was a top priority when we built BrainDock. We don't permanently store anything, we don't use facial recognition, and your session data stays on your device. BrainDock is here to help you focus, not collect your personal information.

screenSharing.question: Is sharing your screen private and safe?
screenSharing.answer: Yes, completely. Screen sharing is done entirely on your computer and works offline. BrainDock only reads the name of your active window to check against your distraction list. No screenshots are taken, no recordings are made, and nothing regarding this leaves your machine.

whatCanNotice.question: What can BrainDock actually notice during your session?
whatCanNotice.answer: BrainDock can notice activities during your session. For example, stepping away from your desk, distractions like using your phone, tablets, game controllers, etc. The best part is that it only flags these when you're actually using them in front of your screen, not just because they're nearby.

internetConnection.question: Does BrainDock require an internet connection?
internetConnection.answer: Screen sharing operates entirely offline, as it runs locally on your computer. AI-powered distraction sensing requires an internet connection to identify devices such as phones and tablets; however, no data is stored permanently on servers, and any data sent for analysis is discarded after processing.

cloudData.question: Is my data uploaded to the Cloud?
cloudData.answer: Your session statistics, reports, and personal data remain on your computer. For distraction sensing, frames are temporarily transmitted to our AI models for analysis and then deleted. No data is stored permanently, and we do not retain records of your sessions.

howToUse.title: How to Use BrainDock
howToUse.subtitle: A simple guide to get you started.
howToUse.step1Download: Download the app from the Download page.
howToUse.step2Account: Create an account or sign in on this website.
howToUse.step3SignIn: Open BrainDock and sign in with the same account (or use the login code from this site).
howToUse.macStep2: Click "Open" in the dialog. This only happens once.
howToUse.macStep3: When asked for camera access, click OK.
howToUse.winStep1: Run BrainDock-Setup.exe. If SmartScreen appears, click More info then Run anyway.
howToUse.winStep2: Follow the installer. A desktop shortcut and Start Menu entry will be created.
howToUse.winStep3: When asked for camera access, click Allow.
howToUse.sessionStep1: Click the BrainDock icon in the menu bar (macOS) or system tray (Windows).
howToUse.sessionStep2: Pick your mode: Camera, Screen, or Both.
howToUse.sessionStep3: Press "Start Session". Pause or stop any time from the menu.
howToUse.modeCameraDesc: Uses AI to notice when you step away or pick up a phone/tablet. No video is saved.
howToUse.modeScreenDesc: Checks your active window against your blocklist. Works offline.
howToUse.modeBothDesc: Camera and screen combined for full coverage.
howToUse.tip1: Good lighting on your face helps accuracy.
howToUse.tip2: Sit facing the camera, within 1 to 2 metres.
howToUse.tip3: Keep one person in the frame at a time.
howToUse.tip4: Only active gadget use is flagged. A phone on the desk while you work is fine.
howToUse.blocklistDesc: Choose which sites and apps count as off-task in Settings → Blocklist.
howToUse.blocklistDesc2: Use Quick Block for common sites, enable whole categories, or add your own URLs and app names. Changes sync to the app when you start your next session.
howToUse.reportsIntro: After each session a PDF is saved to your Downloads folder. It includes:
howToUse.reportItem3: A visual timeline of your session
howToUse.reportsCta: You can also view past sessions on the Sessions page.
howToUse.faq1Q: How do I pause or stop a session?
howToUse.faq1A: Click the BrainDock icon in your menu bar or system tray, then choose Pause or Stop. You can resume a paused session at any time.
howToUse.faq2Q: How do I change my focus mode?
howToUse.faq2A: Open the BrainDock popup from the menu bar or system tray and pick Camera, Screen, or Both before starting a session.
howToUse.faq3Q: Where are my PDF reports saved?
howToUse.faq3A: Reports are automatically saved to your Downloads folder when a session ends. You can also view session history on the Sessions page of this website.
howToUse.faq4Q: How do I add a website or app to my blocklist?
howToUse.faq4A: Go to Settings → Blocklist on this website. You can toggle common sites, enable categories, or type in a custom URL or app name. Your changes sync to the desktop app automatically.
howToUse.faq5Q: Can I use BrainDock on more than one computer?
howToUse.faq5A: Yes. Install the app on each computer and sign in with the same account. Your settings and blocklist sync across all your devices.
howToUse.faq6Q: Does screen-only mode work without internet?
howToUse.faq6A: Yes. Screen-only mode runs entirely on your computer and does not need an internet connection. Camera mode needs internet for the AI.
howToUse.faq7Q: A phone on my desk was incorrectly flagged. Why?
howToUse.faq7A: BrainDock only flags active gadget use (e.g. scrolling or looking at a phone). If this still happens, try adjusting your camera angle or improving lighting. You can also turn off specific gadget types in Settings → Configuration.
